column1: Assistant Manager - MSME Partnerships and Govt Liaison
column2: We are seeking a highly motivated Asst. Manager - MSME Partnerships and Govt Liaison to join our team within the MSME vertical.          The ideal candidate will have a passion for fostering strategic partnerships, driving business growth, and supporting the needs of MSMEs.          This role offers an exciting opportunity to contribute to the expansion and success of our organization in the MSME sector.                Key Responsibilities:             Partner Identification and Engagement:               Identify potential partnership opportunities with key stakeholders in the MSME ecosystem, including financial institutions, industry associations, government agencies, and technology providers.        Develop and maintain relationships with existing and potential partners to facilitate collaboration and drive mutual business objectives.        Coordinate partnership activities, including meetings, presentations, and joint initiatives, to enhance our presence and offerings in the MSME market.            Business Development Support:             Support the development and execution of business development strategies to acquire and retain MSME clients.        Collaborate with internal teams to tailor solutions and offerings to meet the unique needs of MSMEs, leveraging insights from partnerships and market research.        Assist in the creation of marketing collateral, proposals, and presentations for MSME clients and partners.            Market Research and Analysis:               Conduct market research and analysis to identify trends, opportunities, and challenges within the MSME sector.          Monitor competitor activities and industry developments to inform strategic decision-making and enhance our competitive positioning.          Generate insights and recommendations based on market intelligence to support business planning and decision-making processes.                      Project Management:               Manage projects related to partnerships and business development initiatives within the MSME vertical, ensuring timely execution and delivery of key milestones.          Coordinate cross-functional teams and external partners to drive project outcomes and achieve business objectives.              Track project performance metrics and provide regular updates to stakeholders on progress and outcomes.                              Requirements              Bachelors degree in Business Administration, Economics, Finance, or related field. Masters degree preferred.          5 to 7 years of experience in partnerships, business development or related roles, preferably within the MSME sector.          Strong understanding of the MSME ecosystem, including knowledge of financial products/services, regulatory landscape, and market dynamics.          Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to build and maintain relationships with diverse stakeholders.          Proven ability to think strategically, analyze data, and translate insights into actionable recommendations.          Demonstrated project management skills, including the ability to manage multiple priorities and stakeholders in a fast-paced environment.          Proficiency in Microsoft Office suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint)
column11: Business administration, Interpersonal skills, Strategic partnerships, financial products, Project management, Finance, Market intelligence, Business planning, Market research, Management

column1: Urgent requirement in Liaisioning Executive- Thane
column2: Key Responsibilities: 1. Government Liaison: - Serve as the primary point of contact for all interactions with government agencies and regulatory bodies. - Stay updated on relevant laws, regulations, policies, and procedures that may impact the company's operations. - Coordinate and facilitate meetings, discussions, and negotiations with government officials as required. - Assist in obtaining necessary permits, licenses, clearances, and approvals from government authorities. 2. Local Authorities Interaction: - Develop and maintain relationships with local authorities, municipal bodies, and community representatives. - Communicate our organization's objectives, projects, and initiatives to local stakeholders. - Address any concerns or issues raised by local authorities and work towards mutually beneficial solutions. 3. Compliance Management: - Ensure compliance with all applicable laws, regulations, and guidelines governing our industry. - Conduct regular audits and assessments to identify compliance gaps and implement corrective actions. - Keep abreast of changes in regulatory requirements and advise relevant departments on compliance matters. 4. Issue Resolution: - Act as a mediator in resolving disputes or conflicts between the company and external stakeholders. - Investigate complaints or grievances from external parties and work towards resolving them in a timely and satisfactory manner. - Escalate significant issues to higher management and provide recommendations for resolution. 5. Documentation and Reporting: - Maintain accurate records of all interactions, communications, and transactions with external parties. - Prepare reports, presentations, and documentation required for regulatory submissions, compliance updates, and stakeholder meetings. - Provide regular updates to management on key developments, challenges, and opportunities related to liaison activities. Qualifications and Skills: - Bachelor's degree in Business Administration, Public Administration, Law, or related field. (Advanced degree preferred) - Proven experience in Liaisioning, government relations, or regulatory affairs role in real estate. - Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to interact effectively with individuals at all levels. - Strong negotiation, problem-solving, and conflict resolution abilities. - In-depth knowledge of relevant laws, regulations, and procedures. - High level of integrity, professionalism, and ethical conduct. - Proficiency in MS Office suite and other relevant software applications. - Ability to work independently and as part of a team, with a proactive and results-oriented approach. Additional Requirements: - Willingness to travel as needed. - Flexibility to work outside regular business hours when necessary.

column2: Everest Fleet is Ubers largest professionally managed fleet supplier in India, with a fleet of 15,000+ cars, operating in Mumbai, Pune, Bengaluru, Delhi, Hyderabad, Chennai and Kolkata. It was founded by a successful entrepreneur, philanthropist and seasoned angel investor Siddharth Ladsariya in October 2016. As we are one of the most professionally managed fleets of the country, Uber India has entered into a strategic partnership with us. Our goals are to reach 35000 cars by the end of 2024. With an aim to generate 1 lakh jobs and create an ecosystem benefiting the entire value chain - drivers, aggregators, investors & employees, Everest Fleet envisions becoming the preferred operating partner in the industry over the next 5 years. Current team size is of 1500+ employees and 15,000+ drivers. We are currently building a core team which will be responsible for the organisations growth. Organizational and Government Compliance Officer Job Summary: The Organizational and Government Compliance Officer is responsible for ensuring that the organization and its employees comply with all government applicable laws and regulations. This position requires a thorough knowledge of the laws and regulations that govern the organization and its operations, as well as the ability to develop, implement, and monitor effective compliance programs. column2: The District M&E Manager in collaboration with DAPCU, District and State Management team will provide and mentoring to all treatment facilities in the assigned geography. In addition, will support data analysis of HIV testing data across five districts for prioritizing Index Testing and Social Network based HIV testing activities. Data M&E Manager will be reporting to District Manager.                              ?               The specific duties will include:                                                             Support State/ DAPCU/ ACCELERATE in use of existing data on HIV testing and treatment from various sources to prioritize interventions including scale-up approaches.                               Provide proactive feedback to SACS/DAPCU/ ACCELERATE Team to improve data quality.                               Develop data management tools, excel based dashboards, analytics frameworks and innovations to ensure continuous and harmonized data collection, validation, analysis for monitoring and evaluation of program performance                               Synthesize program performance data/information and promote its use in decision-making for program service delivery and resource allocation through leading analyses, discussions with NACO and other measures                               Regularly analyses the data captured in the MIS and provide summary of findings and recommendations. Work closely with DAPCU and NGO partners to address gaps, if any.                               Conduct regular trainings of district staff and NGOs to strengthen understanding of data systems and reporting.                               Contribute to public health research study design and execution, including the design of sampling methodologies, determination of study sample sizes, collection of management and analysis of study data                               Assist in activities of data segregation and compilation; analysis and descriptive report on the data set.                               Coordinate with team members, DAPCU, ART Centre, community representatives.                               Any other work assigned by supervisor within ambit of the project ACCELERATE.                         Qualifications and skills                             bachelors Degree; additional computer training or certification will be an asset                                Minimum 3 years work experience as a data analyst.                               Experience in working on large data sets                                Experience in performing data validation and quality checks                                Excellent ability in using MS Excel and PowerPoint                               Experience in leading facility-based program monitoring and evaluation activities will be preferred.                               Excellent written and oral communication, liaison and negotiation skills                               Self-motivated, with a strong ability and drive to lead project activities independently with minimal supervision.                               Willingness to travel for appx 20 days a month. (Travel and logistic support will be provided under project)                               Knowledge of Telugu language

column2: This is an exciting opportunity to be at the heart of the legal engineering function at ContractPodAi by working with the award-winning Auto-Contract Desk. We are looking to maximise the continued roll-out of this functionality across a wide range of client implementations. We are looking to hire a Document Automation Editor with experience using Microsoft Word and advanced formatting/authoring tools. The ideal candidate will possess a keen eye for detail and have excellent problem-solving skills. Experience working with CLM platforms and/or legal technologies is highly desirable.               Roles & Responsibilities:       Reformatting documents using advanced formatting tools on Microsoft Word.   Defining, testing, and implementing automated documents using document automation technology to streamline contract generation.   Using ContractPodAi collaborate functionality to initiate formatting exercise.   Assisting Legal Engineers with client implementations and artificial intelligence initiatives.   Assisting sales and customer success teams with document creation.   Providing insights on legal market and technology trends.   Delivering training, presentations, and demonstrations of ContractPodAi Auto Contract Desk and other Legal Engineering initiatives.               Required Competencies:       6 months experience in a similar role.   Technical or Bachelor s degree required.   Law degree or equivalent knowledge or skill (highly desirable), or any graduate.   Experience in drafting, reviewing, and reformatting a wide range of documents.   Excellent knowledge of IT packages - Microsoft Word (essential), Excel and PowerPoint.   Experience working with CLM platforms and/or legal technologies (desirable).   Team player - with a demonstrable commitment to the success of the Legal Engineering team.   Excellent communication skills - English (essential).   Excellent time management skills, able to deliver agreed results whilst managing multiple projects concurrently.   Attention to detail and accuracy in document creation and editing.   Ability to work using initiative to ensure wider team success.   Problem-solving - troubleshooting issues identified.
column11: Training delivery, Automation, Time management, Artificial Intelligence, Legal, Packaging, Management, Troubleshooting, microsoft, Powerpoint

column2: Position: Liaison Officer    Location: Chennai    Responsibilities: - Act as the primary point of contact between the company and government   agencies, regulatory bodies, and local authorities.  - Ensure compliance with all statutory and legal requirements related to real estate projects.  - Handle documentation and paperwork related to permissions, approvals, and licenses.  - Address and resolve any issues that arise with bankers or other external entities promptly.   Qualifications: - Bachelor's degree in Law, Public Administration, or a related field.  - 5+ years of experience in a liaison role, preferably in the real estate sector.  - In-depth knowledge of the registration process and document registration procedures is mandatory.  - Strong understanding of local regulations and legal procedures.  - Excellent communication and negotiation skills.  - Proactive and detail-oriented approach

column2: Railtech Infraventutres Pvt. Ltd.  is looking for Liaison Manager  to join our dynamic team and embark on a rewarding career journey     Communication Facilitation: Act as a central point of contact for communication between different departments or teams within an organization     Ensure that information is conveyed clearly and promptly     Interdepartmental Coordination: Facilitate collaboration and coordination between various departments, ensuring that they work together harmoniously to achieve organizational objectives     Stakeholder Engagement: Establish and maintain relationships with external stakeholders, such as clients, partners, vendors, or regulatory authorities     Communicate their needs and requirements to internal teams     Conflict Resolution: Mediate and resolve conflicts or disagreements between departments or teams, finding mutually acceptable solutions     Project Management: Assist in project management by overseeing the flow of information and ensuring that project-related tasks are completed on time     Information Sharing: Ensure that important information, updates, and reports are shared among relevant parties and that confidentiality and data security are maintained     Policy and Procedure Alignment: Ensure that departments and teams align their practices with organizational policies and procedures, as well as industry standards     Change Management: Help manage and communicate changes within the organization, ensuring that employees are well-informed and prepared for transitions     Resource Allocation: Assist in resource allocation and distribution, ensuring that departments have the necessary resources to carry out their tasks efficiently

column2: As a Diamond Office Liaison at our jewelry company, you will play a crucial role in facilitating communication and coordination between our diamond office and the production factory      Your primary responsibility will be to ensure seamless follow-ups and efficient flow of information between these two key departments          Key Responsibilities:                Communication Facilitation:    Act as the main point of contact between the diamond office and the production factory.        Ensure timely and accurate exchange of information, instructions, and requirements between the two departments.        Communicate any changes in orders, specifications, or deadlines effectively to both teams.        Order Tracking and Follow-ups:        Monitor the progress of diamond orders from the diamond office to the production factory.        Conduct regular follow-ups to ensure that orders are processed, produced, and shipped according to schedule.        Address any delays or issues promptly and proactively seek solutions to minimize disruptions.    Quality Assurance:        Collaborate with both the diamond office and production factory to maintain high-quality standards throughout the manufacturing process.        Conduct quality checks at various stages of production to ensure adherence to specifications and standards.        Report any quality concerns or deviations to the relevant teams and assist in implementing corrective actions.        Documentation and Record-Keeping:        Maintain accurate records of all diamond orders, production schedules, and communications between departments.        Ensure that all documentation related to orders, shipments, and quality control procedures is properly organized and accessible.        Problem Resolution:        Act as a mediator in resolving any conflicts or misunderstandings that may arise between the diamond office and production factory.    Proactively identify potential issues and work towards finding solutions to prevent them from escalating.    Qualifications and Skills:      Bachelor s degree in Business Administration, Supply Chain Management, or a related field.        Previous experience in a similar role within the jewelry industry is highly preferred.        Strong communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to      effectively interact with individuals at all levels.    Excellent organizational skills and attention to detail.        Problem-solving abilities and the capacity to work under pressure.        Proficiency in MS Office suite and other relevant software applications.        Knowledge of diamond grading and manufacturing processes is an advantage. (if possible)            Facebook          Twitter          Email          Share
column11: MS Office suite, Business administration, Supply chain management, Interpersonal skills, Quality standards, Manager Quality Assurance, Manufacturing process, UPS, Manager Quality Control, Application software

column2: Basic Function To assist the Legal Function. Should be capable of handling multiple legal assignments and ensure minimization of legal risks to the organization.  Meeting deadlines with minimum turnaround time in handling legal matters.   Essential Functions US Licensing ? Responsible for renewal of US licences (TPA, Collection, Telemarketing & COA) for: Exl India and OPIPL India entities; and its record keeping Co-ordinate with external counsels on licensing issues and queries around the same Legal Vendors ???Work with EXL Procurement Team for on-boarding the vendors and updation of vendor records and also complete the vendor audit with commercial team Work with Commercial Team for creating the Purchase Order Work with EXL Finance Team for processing payments ??maintain and track all the payments authorized and paid by EXL Finance Records Management ???Custodian for all secretarial and Legal records Performing compliance check and ensure GRC reports timely submission Coordinate with internal clients and Contract Management System Team for maintaining robust contracts repository and sharing with required stakeholders, as needed Corporate Governance ???assist in the management of corporate governance matters for legal entities, including, charter and by-law changes, maintenance of minute books, stock registers and current officer and director listings;? Maintain all the secretarial and litigations records and documentation, as per statutory and legal requirement Co-ordinate with external counsels and attorneys on Secretarial and Litigations matters, including physical presence for various court hearing on behalf of EXL and its affiliates, documentation and record keeping around the same (e.g. notarization of the documents, Court proceeding etc.) Support Company Secretary in holding board meetings and drafting minutes of meeting and board meeting attendance sheet, and assisting when required Maintain Corporate Data Sheets and the worldwide corporate database for all legal entities Misc Assist in the administration of Legal Team corporate projects, including putting together PowerPoints and other presentations; and Perform information searches concerning Company operations in response to RFIs/RFPs. Review corporate filings and work with internal teams to submit to the appropriate state Assist with board meetings presentations ??research relevant and necessary topics/data to include in presentation deck   Education Requirements B.A. Legal qualification is desirable but not mandatory Professional demeanor in all situations. Ability to manage the demanding internal and external clients while retaining composure. Work Experience Requirements At least 5 years of corporate legal/ paralegal experience performing some or all of the tasks noted in the Primary Responsibility field above.
